intro: Waltheria glabra, commonly known as smooth waltheria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. Waltheria glabra is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in humid, subtropical climates.
